note.p: Burial: Burton, but later removed to Bruhenny (Churchtown)
Education: Christ Church, Oxford (matriculated 1676); Lincoln's Inn (admitted 1678)

Career: Clerk of the Crown; Prothonotary and Chief Clerk of the Common Pleas; Keeper of the writs and other records of the Court of the King's Bench (Ireland); died of gaol fever, caught while serving as foreman of a Grand Jury at the Assizes at Cork
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB (son's entry); Hunter; GEC Baronetage; Foster; LI
Notes: Proposed by Sir Robert Southwell. Hunter gives election date as 13 April 1681 and the date has been changed from 6 Apr to 13 Apr in BR; index to BR and R give 06 April 1681.
